interaction_summary:
=== Purchase Information ===
Product Title: Focus (Blu-ray )
Review Date: 2015/11/12
Store: Will Smith  (Actor),     Margot Robbie  (Actor)    Rated:    R    Format: Blu-ray
Categories: Movies & TV, Featured Categories, Blu-ray, Comedy
Product Description: ['Focus (Blu-ray)', 'Will Smith stars as Nicky, a seasoned master of misdirection who becomes romantically involved with novice con artist Jess (Margot Robbie) as he’s teaching her the tricks of the trade.', ']]>']
Average Rating: 4.6
Product Details: {'Genre': 'Comedy', 'Format': 'Blu-ray', 'Contributor': 'Denise Di Novi, Glenn Ficarra, Charlie Gogolak, Will Smith, Robert Taylor, Rodrigo Santoro, B.D. Wong, Gerald McRaney, John Requa, Margot Robbie, Stan Wlodkowski, Adrian MartinezDenise Di Novi, Glenn Ficarra, Charlie Gogolak, Will Smith, Robert Taylor, Rodrigo Santoro, B.D. Wong, Gerald McRaney, John Requa, Margot Robbie, Stan Wlodkowski, Adrian Martinez   See more', 'Language': 'English (Dolby Digital 5.1), Spanish (Dolby Digital 5.1), English (DTS 5.1)', 'Runtime': '1 hour and 44 minutes', 'Digital Copy Expiration Date': 'June 2, 2018', 'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'MPAA rating': 'R (Restricted)', 'Product Dimensions': '0.6 x 5.4 x 6.7 inches; 3.2 Ounces', 'Item model number': '34050049', 'Director': 'John Requa, Glenn Ficarra', 'Media Format': 'Blu-ray', 'Run time': '1 hour and 44 minutes', 'Release date': 'June 2, 2015', 'Actors': 'Will Smith, Margot Robbie, Rodrigo Santoro, Gerald McRaney, Adrian Martinez', 'Subtitles': 'French, Portuguese, Spanish', 'Producers': 'Denise Di Novi, Charlie Gogolak, Stan Wlodkowski', 'Studio': 'WarnerBrothers', 'Writers': 'John Requa, Glenn Ficarra', 'Number of discs': '1'}
Review Text: Great movie.  But the action is fast and discreet so save movie until you are ready to really watch it closely. Both lead actors put in exceptional performances to say the least. Be sure to keep an eye on the gruffy old bouncer too.  BTW; Ms Robbie is very pleasant visually and was surprisingly effective in this role (would not have minded seeing a lot more of her...;)
Review Title: Great Movie -- a must see
Rating: 5.0
--------------------------------------------------

Defying Gravity: Season 1 Livingston, Ron (Actor), Airlie, Andrew (Actor) Rated: Unrated Format: DVD Movies & TV, Studio Specials, 20th Century Fox Home Entertainment, Fox TV, General ['Set in the very near future, eight astronauts from five countries undertake a mysterious six-year international mission on the spaceship Antares. This sexy and provocative sci fi thriller follows 4 men and 4 women through the solar system where their pasts reveal intimate and interconnected secrets that have a strange effect on the present and mysteries yet to be revealed. DVD includes 5 episodes never seen on television.'] {'Format': 'AC-3, Box set, Multiple Formats, Color, Dolby, NTSC, Subtitled, Widescreen', 'Contributor': 'Yoba, Malik, Airlie, Andrew, Livingston, Ron', 'Language': 'Unqualified', 'Runtime': '9 hours and 20 minutes', 'Studio': '20th Century Fox', 'Aspect Ratio': '1.78:1', 'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'MPAA rating': 'Unrated (Not Rated)', 'Product Dimensions': '0.7 x 7.5 x 5.4 inches; 6.4 Ounces', 'Item model number': '109899521990', 'Media Format': 'AC-3, Box set, Multiple Formats, Color, Dolby, NTSC, Subtitled, Widescreen', 'Run time': '9 hours and 20 minutes', 'Release date': 'January 19, 2010', 'Actors': 'Livingston, Ron, Airlie, Andrew, Yoba, Malik', 'Subtitles': 'English, French, Spanish', 'Number of discs': '4'} Good series, better on DVD w/o dumb commercials to interrupt.

Want show brought back!! Good series, better on DVD The Sound of Music Live! Carrie Underwood (Actor), Stephen Moyer (Actor), Beth McCarthy-Miller (Director), Rob Ashford (Director) & 1 more Rated: NR Format: DVD Movies & TV, Award Winners in Movies & TV, Emmy Central, Emmy Nominees ["An aspiring nun in pre-WWII Austria leaves the abbey to become a governess for the widower Captain von Trapp's seven children and finds herself falling in love. Beloved worldwide, The Sound of Music includes unforgettable songs including “Edelweiss”, “Do-Re-Mi,” “My Favorite Things,” and “The Sound of Music”."] {'Aspect Ratio': '1.78:1', 'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'MPAA rating': 'NR (Not Rated)', 'Product Dimensions': '0.7 x 7.5 x 5.4 inches; 2.72 Ounces', 'Item model number': '274264', 'Director': 'Beth McCarthy-Miller, Rob Ashford', 'Media Format': 'Multiple Formats, Color, NTSC, Widescreen', 'Run time': '2 hours and 15 minutes', 'Release date': 'December 17, 2013', 'Actors': 'Carrie Underwood, Stephen Moyer, Laura Benanti, Christian Borle, Audra McDonald', 'Producers': 'Priscilla Taussig', 'Language': 'English (Dolby Digital 5.1)', 'Studio': 'Universal Pictures Home Entertainment', 'Number of discs': '1'} There is a good reason why the original 1959 broadway version is basically lost to time and unknown while the movie version that followed is known to nearly everyone and widely beloved. The movie version rocks and the broadway version in comparision suxs.

Thus having painfully sat through this remake of the broadway version I will rate it a tedious and un-interesting if not embarrassing. Additionally the audio mix in the new one is terrible (or the lead has a very weak voice) and the stage is poor.

Overall nothing in this new version sparkles...I would rate it lower that a typical high school drama club presentation of Fiddler on the Roof...except here I no children I am related to to compele me to attend. And I am sorry I did. Poor at best... {'Content advisory': ['Violence', 'foul language', 'sexual content'], 'Audio languages': ['English', 'English [Audio Description]', 'हिन्दी', 'मराठी', 'తెలుగు', 'Français', 'தமிழ்'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]', 'Français', 'हिन्दी', 'Indonesia', '한국어', 'Bahasa Melayu', 'ไทย', 'Tiếng Việt', '中文（简体）'], 'Directors': ['Gary Ross'], 'Producers': ['Nina Jacobson', 'Jon Kilik'], 'Starring': ['Jennifer Lawrence', 'Josh Hutcherson', 'Liam Hemsworth'], 'Studio': ['SciFi and Fantasy']} I have to guess that I missed something.

Despite all the hype over this, I was just underwhelmed.

A very small story told even smaller. Very ordinary movie? {'Content advisory': ['Violence', 'substance use', 'alcohol use', 'foul language', 'sexual content'], 'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Charles Beeson', 'Jeffrey G. Hunt', 'David Nutter', 'J. Miller Tobin', 'Bryan Spicer', 'Guy Norman Bee', 'Jeff Woolnough', 'Matt Earl Beesley', 'Milan Cheylov', 'Holly Dale'], 'Studio': ['FOX']} TSCC is one of the best of TV and best of Sci-Fi genre. Highly recommend it.

Bummer that it was terminated after 2 seasons, but the writers did end it pretty well. I would love a few more seasons for sure.. I would give it 10 Stars {'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Chip Chalmers', 'Cliff Bole', 'David Carson', 'Gabrielle Beaumont', 'Michael Wagner', 'Jonathan Frakes', 'Les Landau', 'Robert Legato', 'Robert Scheerer', 'Robert Wiemer', 'Shari Goodhart', 'Timothy Bond', 'Tom Benko', 'Winrich Kolbe'], 'Producers': ['Rick Berman', 'Michael Piller', 'Jeri Taylor'], 'Starring': ['Patrick Stewart', 'Jonathan Frakes', 'Levar Burton'], 'Studio': ['CBS']} A good season. Nothing to really complain about. A good season. Interstellar (Blu-ray + DVD Combo Pack) Nolan, Christopher (Director), McConaughey, Matthew (Actor), Hathaway, Anne (Actor) & 0 more Rated: PG-13 Format: Blu-ray Movies & TV, Award Winners in Movies & TV, Oscar Central, Past Oscar Winners ['With our time on Earth coming to an end, a team of explorers undertakes the most important mission in human history; traveling beyond this galaxy to discover whether mankind has a future among the stars.'] {'Genre': 'Drama', 'Format': 'Blu-ray, Color, DTS Surround Sound, Digital_copy, Subtitled, Widescreen', 'Contributor': 'Burstyn, Ellen, McConaughey, Matthew, Affleck, Casey, Caine, Michael, Lithgow, John, Gyasi, David, Nolan, Christopher, Foy, MacKenzie, Hathaway, Anne, Chastain, JessicaBurstyn, Ellen, McConaughey, Matthew, Affleck, Casey, Caine, Michael, Lithgow, John, Gyasi, David, Nolan, Christopher, Foy, MacKenzie, Hathaway, Anne, Chastain, Jessica See more', 'Language': 'English', 'Runtime': '2 hours and 48 minutes', 'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'MPAA rating': 'PG-13 (Parents Strongly Cautioned)', 'Product Dimensions': '0.7 x 7.5 x 5.4 inches; 0.32 Ounces', 'Item model number': '59165890000', 'Director': 'Nolan, Christopher', 'Media Format': 'Blu-ray, Color, DTS Surround Sound, Digital_copy, Subtitled, Widescreen', 'Run time': '2 hours and 48 minutes', 'Release date': 'March 31, 2015', 'Actors': 'McConaughey, Matthew, Hathaway, Anne, Caine, Michael, Chastain, Jessica, Affleck, Casey', 'Subtitles': 'English, French, Spanish', 'Studio': 'Warner Home Video', 'Number of discs': '2'} Pretty meager as a full length feature movie. profile:
**Updated User Profile Summary:**

The user maintains a strong investment in sci-fi and character-driven narratives, particularly those showcasing complex interpersonal dynamics. Their recent review highlights a marked shift, with a critical perspective on a previously acclaimed film, indicating disappointment despite recognizing the lead actor's strong performance. This reflects their commitment to high-quality storytelling and thematic depth while exhibiting a discerning approach toward cinematic adaptations.

In contrast, the user recently expressed enthusiasm for a comedic Blu-ray that showcased exceptional performances from the lead actors, indicating a balance in their taste for both serious drama and lighter fare. Their appreciation for immersive viewing experiences continues, favoring DVD and box set formats for their quality.

The user's nostalgic connection to past favorites influences their viewing habits, prompting rigorous comparisons with new works. This emphasizes their goal of seeking emotionally resonant content that meets their high expectations for quality.

Overall, the user is a discerning viewer who values deep narratives and immersive experiences. Their critical engagement with contemporary works, complemented by enthusiastic reviews of their favorite films, underscores a commitment to authentic media consumption and storytelling that captivates and resonates on multiple levels.
